title: 'Extremely dangerous' Hurricane Beryl nears Caribbean, becomes earliest category 4 storm on record
Boeing offered 737 MAX plea deal, lawyer of crash victims' families says
content: Boeing faces scrutiny over the 737 MAX crashes, with the DOJ offering a plea deal involving fines and external oversight. The families of the victims express opposition, pushing for a trial. CEO Dave Calhoun acknowledges the safety crisis and upcoming resignation.
summary: Boeing faces scrutiny over the 737 MAX crashes, with the DOJ offering a plea deal involving fines and external oversight. The families of the victims express opposition, pushing for a trial. CEO Dave Calhoun acknowledges the safety crisis and upcoming resignation.

title: 'Bad debates happen': Allies support Biden, tell him to stay in the race
Setback for Macron: Far Right wins first round of election in France
content: Following the parliamentary election's first round, France faces a pivotal moment with the National Rally party's rise. The political dynamics suggest a significant challenge to President Macron's leadership, prompting discussions of potential alliances and the need for cohesive democratic responses to navigate the evolving landscape effectively.
summary: Following the parliamentary election's first round, France faces a pivotal moment with the National Rally party's rise. The political dynamics suggest a significant challenge to President Macron's leadership, prompting discussions of potential alliances and the need for cohesive democratic responses to navigate the evolving landscape effectively.

title: Mother of war hero questions decision to award Prince Harry the Pat Tillman award
content: The announcement has sparked controversy, including displeasure voiced on air by TV host Pat McAfee and dissatisfaction expressed by the mother of the fallen soldier, who noted she was not consulted about the decision.
summary: The announcement has sparked controversy, including displeasure voiced on air by TV host Pat McAfee and dissatisfaction expressed by the mother of the fallen soldier, who noted she was not consulted about the decision.

Donald Trump's daughter-in-law says Kamala Harris polls as bad as Biden
content: "Millions of Americans came out in those primaries and voted for Joe Biden to be their nominee on the Democrat side. If they decide right here in the 11th hour to plug somebody else in, and it's not Kamala Harris, I can't think of a bigger assault to our democratic process than doing just that. But let's see what they do. Regardless if it's Joe Biden [or] Kamala Harris, Donald Trump's polls show us right now that the American people are behind him," Lara Trump told Fox News.
summary: "Millions of Americans came out in those primaries and voted for Joe Biden to be their nominee on the Democrat side. If they decide right here in the 11th hour to plug somebody else in, and it's not Kamala Harris, I can't think of a bigger assault to our democratic process than doing just that. But let's see what they do. Regardless if it's Joe Biden [or] Kamala Harris, Donald Trump's polls show us right now that the American people are behind him," Lara Trump told Fox News.

title: 'Far-right seen winning 34% of vote in round 1 of France polls'
content: Marine Le Pen's National Rally (RN) led the first round of France's parliamentary elections with about 34% of the vote. President Macron's Together alliance secured 20.5%-23%, while the New Popular Front got around 29%. The final outcome hinges on next week's run-off and political alliances in France's 577 constituencies. Voter turnout was nearly 60%. Le Pen seeks an RN majority to form a government, while Macron urges voters to prevent the far-right from taking office.
summary: Marine Le Pen's National Rally (RN) led the first round of France's parliamentary elections with about 34% of the vote. President Macron's Together alliance secured 20.5%-23%, while the New Popular Front got around 29%. The final outcome hinges on next week's run-off and political alliances in France's 577 constituencies. Voter turnout was nearly 60%. Le Pen seeks an RN majority to form a government, while Macron urges voters to prevent the far-right from taking office.

title: Iran election shows declining voter support amid calls for change
Biden using teleprompter won't be enough, says Scaramucci
content: New York Times which also called Biden to opt out of the contest noted the stark differences between the two Bidens. Joe Biden Two, with the help of a teleprompter, is enthusiastic and forceful, clear and concise on his position on abortion, immigration, taxes and race. "Joe Biden Two was clear about Mr. Trump’s threat to democracy. Joe Biden One left viewers scratching their heads about the topic that the president has long said motivated his run in 2020," NYT observed.
summary: New York Times which also called Biden to opt out of the contest noted the stark differences between the two Bidens. Joe Biden Two, with the help of a teleprompter, is enthusiastic and forceful, clear and concise on his position on abortion, immigration, taxes and race. Joe Biden One left viewers scratching their heads about the topic that the president has long said motivated his run in 2020," NYT observed.

title: This historian predicted 9/10 election results correctly. On Biden, he says..
content: Historian Allan Lichtman is credited to have predicted 9 out of 10 election results correctly. Amid clamors for replacing Joe Biden as the Democrat's presidential candidate, he said it could cost the Democrat the 2024 election. He said it will be a huge mistake as those who are asking Biden to bow out of the contest are not doctors and they do not know whether Biden is capable of continuing another term or not. "This is foolhardy nonsense," the American University historian said on CNN.
summary: Historian Allan Lichtman is credited to have predicted 9 out of 10 election results correctly. Amid clamors for replacing Joe Biden as the Democrat's presidential candidate, he said it could cost the Democrat the 2024 election. He said it will be a huge mistake as those who are asking Biden to bow out of the contest are not doctors and they do not know whether Biden is capable of continuing another term or not. "This is foolhardy nonsense," the American University historian said on CNN.

title: Pakistan woman leader's video viral: 'Why don't you make eye contact'
content: "My party leaders have taught me to speak looking into the eyes. I can't continue speaking if you avoid eye contact like this. Wear your glasses, sir," Zartaj Gul told Speaker Ayaz Sadiq. "I am a leader. I have got 1.5 lakh votes. If you don't listen to me, I will not be able to speak to you," Zartaj Gul said.
summary: "My party leaders have taught me to speak looking into the eyes. I can't continue speaking if you avoid eye contact like this. Wear your glasses, sir," Zartaj Gul told Speaker Ayaz Sadiq. "I am a leader. I have got 1.5 lakh votes. If you don't listen to me, I will not be able to speak to you," Zartaj Gul said.
